DataElement.preferredName: Patient Health Insurance Post Trial Screening Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether a patient who did not have health insurance at the time of screening for a clinical trial obtained coverage later.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Health Insurance Post Trial Screening
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A mechanism for guarding against financial aspects of risk by making payments in the form of premiums to an insurance company, which pays an agreed-upon sum to the insured in the event of loss._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._A process of active consideration of potential subjects for enrollment in a trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:A mechanism for guarding against financial aspects of risk by making payments in the form of premiums to an insurance company, which pays an agreed-upon sum to the insured in the event of loss.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A mechanism for guarding against financial aspects of risk by making payments in the form of premiums to an insurance company, which pays an agreed-upon sum to the insured in the event of loss.

Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A process of active consideration of potential subjects for enrollment in a trial.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A process of active consideration of potential subjects for enrollment in a trial.
